trait.name: Ability Score Increases
trait.text: Your Wisdom score increases by 1. Two other ability scores of your choice, except Constitution, increase by 1 each.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: The taii'makus experience a swift maturation, concluding childhood at 8 years and achieving adulthood at the age of 16. Rarely do they live past the age of 80.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most taii'maku are lawful, holding strong beliefs in the systems and laws of their Ilus. They tend to neutrality over good and evil, keeping their personal beliefs to themselves for the greater good of society.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Taii'maku are taller than humans, standing well over 6 to 7 feet tall and averaging 210 to 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Historical Nomadism
trait.text: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: History or Survival.

trait.name: Strong Hands
trait.text: Endowed with six fingers, taii'makus possess enhanced hand strength. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to climbing and saving throws against disarming effects.

trait.name: Mathematical Mind
trait.text: The unique and logical thought pro cess of the taii'maku grant them an edge with numbers and math. You have advantage on all ability checks directly in volving mathematical or accounting tasks.

trait.name: Mind Inclination
trait.text: Rather than subspecies, taii'maku display dispositions inclined either towards Philosophy, with a comprehensive approach, or Engineering, focusing on specific areas of study.

trait.name: Inclination to Philosophy
trait.text: Taii'maku that choose to follow the philosopher way seek balance, physical and mental, of nature and mechanics. They want to be holistic and fix their own flaws constantly, improving in multiple skills and become ambivalent.

trait.name: Equilibrium
trait.text: The taii'maku learn to harness their individual limits in pursuit of balance. If the difference between your highest and lowest ability scores is no more than 2, you're considered "in balance". While in balance, your lowest ability scores are considered 2 points higher, impacting your attacks, saving throws, ability checks, and any other features referencing these ability scores. At 6th level, this applies to all your ability scores (instead of only the lowest).

trait.name: Expanded Knowledge
trait.text: You gain a +2 bonus to all ability checks (including when using skills). If you are "in balance," this bonus is also applied to all saving throws.

trait.name: Expanded Insight
trait.text: Anytime you would gain a +1 bonus to an ability score from a feat, you can apply it to a different ability score. This decision, once made, is permanent. (This feature applies only if your game includes the optional feat rules.)

trait.name: Languages
trait.text:
You can speak, read, and write Common and Taii'makian.

Taii'makian runes, made up of geometric shapes, represent words and concepts; by combining up to four runes, a greater concept is created, resembling a sentence in Common. Foreigners often view these lines and markings as complicated mechanical sketches.

Their excep tional construction and engineering expertise have vastly improved the quality of life in these regions. They have al so established a nuanced relationship with the Magocracy of Mage Tower, engaging in lively debates and exchanging wisdom with their mages. However, the taii'maku remain wary, expressing concerns about the ethical implications of certain experiments conducted by the Magocracy.

trait.name: Contributing to a Better World
trait.text: The taii'maku stand in Tanares as architects of progress, tirelessly striving to forge a harmonious existence for all inhabitants. Their commitment to innovation and progress has given rise to astonishing constructs that seamlessly perform tasks, ensuring transportation, security, and unwavering support in their quest for an idyllic society. Masters of their craft, the taii'maku have achieved seemingly impossible feats: quenching the parched desert with life-giving water, taming the fury of unyielding floods, and constructing sophisticated sanitation systems. Their ingenious roadways bridge the gaps between cities and kingdoms, fostering unity and cooperation in the face of adversity. Taii'maku cities serve as radiant beacons of their grand vision, with constructs assuming the mantle of manual labor, allowing the citizens to immerse themselves in contemplation, research, and personal growth. Massive mechanical wagons and swift-flying vessels transport people with ease, while constructs dutifully cater to every conceivable task. In their pursuit of a brighter future, the taii'maku remain ever vigilant against the persistent menace of the kikoku. With unwavering resolve, they thwart these sinister creatures' attempts to reproduce and breach their resplendent cities. The taii'maku wield wisdom and reason as formidable weapons, serving as advisors and guides in a world beset by strife and corruption. Their most gifted strategists and thinkers labor tirelessly to craft intricate plans and tactics to counter the insidious influence of the Ungods, extending aid and warnings to other realms, even when their words fall on deaf ears. Through their steadfast dedication to logic and unyielding resistance to the vices and temptations of the Ungods, the taii'maku emerge as a formidable adversary in the battle against malevolent forces. Their very existence presents a challenge that the Ungods are all too eager to eliminate, yet the taii'maku remain undeterred, resolute in their mission to unite and uplift the denizens of Tanares.

trait.name: Taii'maku Society
trait.text: In the heart of the taii'maku civilization, a steadfast dedication to logic, rationality, and the pursuit of knowledge beats like a resonant drum. Eschewing traditional faith in deities, they perceive gods as highly evolved entities, masters of profound wisdom and comprehension of reality. Within their ranks, clerics and paladins exist, but they view them selves as emissaries of superior wisdom rather than servants of a divine being. The essence of taii'maku culture lies in order and balance, reflected by their harmonious, symmetrical, and geometric city architecture. Crafted with meticulous accuracy, their urban landscapes optimize mystical energy efficiency and resource management. Their cuisine, mirroring their methodical nature, emphasizes objectivity and efficiency over taste and presentation, crafting meals that deliver optimal health and nutrient intake. In their relationships, the taii'maku exhibit an extraordinary form of empathy. Devoid of emotional experience, it stems from understanding the logical and practical needs of others. Their ethical framework originates from a deep thought experiment in which they shed all knowledge of identity, status, and personal circumstances to impartially inhabit the lives of every individual. This process allows them to grasp the needs and perspectives of all beings, forging an ethical rule that is equitable and just for all. Such an approach is vital for the taii'maku to create a society that caters to everyone's needs without succumbing to oppression or tyranny. In pursuit of this ideal, they strive for a harmonious societal balance, ensuring the well-being of all without sacrificing the few. Every voice is heard and respected, fostering unity and shared understanding. Marriage in taii'maku society is deemed a logical obligation and lifelong commitment. Couples are selected based on intellectual compatibility and the potential to counter balance each other's weaknesses, resulting in partners with vastly different skill sets. When raising children, taii'maku parents display a profound sense of responsibility, attentive ness, and devotion, particularly in education and imparting wisdom. However, their parenting approach lacks the emotional warmth observed in other species. Society is structured around a knowledge-based hierarchy, with an individual's status determined by their contributions to collective wisdom. Their economy revolves around trading knowledge and bauronite ore, prioritizing the exchange of information, discoveries, ideas, and components for crafts and research over traditional gold coins. This system nurtures a culture of perpetual learning and innovation. Taii'maku governance is anchored in public councils led by the eldest members, inviting anyone with a contribution to engage in discussions. Decisions are made through vot ing, emphasizing logic over personal biases and frequently resulting in unanimous or near-unanimous outcomes, as they discuss until every individual is satisfied. The deep Taii'maku language, comprised of intricate symbols and exact mathematical forms, enables efficient and meticulous idea exchanges, unparalleled in Tanares. In leisure, they partake in intellectual debates, exchanging logical arguments to persuade their audience, or team sports that demand exceptional coordination and tactics.

trait.name: Math, Engineering, and Constructs
trait.text: Within the great halls of the taii'maku civilization, an un paralleled mastery of mathematics, engineering, and magic reverberates through every aspect of their intricate culture. This extraordinary fusion breathes life into a myriad of con structs, each pulsating with the volatile yet potent mystical energies of bauronite. Highly advanced constructs serve as the lifeblood of taii'maku society, ceaselessly fulfilling a diverse array of roles. From performing menial tasks and physical labor to acting as speedy vehicles, these constructs enable the taii'maku to dedicate their time to intellectual pursuits. Sentinel constructs vigilantly patrol the cities, responding to taii'maku commands and maintaining unwavering security. Transportation constructs range from horse-sized golems and massive mechanical wagons to soaring aerial machines and even city-sized, mobile Illus. The zenith of taii'maku engineering culminates in the impressive Giant Defenders, colossal constructs that rival the tallest giants and safeguard the Illus from ever-present threats. Yet, all taii'maku constructs necessitate fastidious maintenance to stave off corruption from their bauronite cores, which, if left unchecked, could render them uncontrollable and perilous. The taii'maku's resolute devotion to order, balance, and precision, coupled with their reverence for knowledge, forms the bedrock of their unique capabilities. They alone possess the aptitude to craft such remarkable constructs. Their culture fosters an environment that encourages ceaseless learning and innovation, transforming these constructs into more than just feats of engineering; they stand as emblematic representations of the taii'maku's relentless pursuit of progress. U'Tibam, the most eminent taii'maku mind of his era, epitomizes their exceptional intellect. His groundbreaking contributions to mathematics and the creation of the mightiest giant construct ever forged, a pivotal weapon against the Kemet Invasion, further highlight the taii'maku's ingenuity. The Illus frequently find themselves in need of specific resources to further their research or repair their constructs, often enlisting the aid of intrepid adventurers to procure the rare materials they require. Taii'Maku cities also tirelessly search for spies and purloined information or artifacts, offering bountiful rewards for their safe recovery. Prioritizing security above all else, the taii'maku remain perpetually vigilant for signs of infiltration, as the secrets of their constructs' creation and operation must be fiercely safeguarded.

trait.name: Mathematical Approach to Magic
trait.text: In the arcane domain, the taii'maku stand as a testament to their revolutionary theories that intricately weave the tapestry of magic with the threads of mathematics. This matchless approach births the crafting of impeccably precise magic circles and potent enchanted artifacts, transcending the symbolic renderings typically employed by their wizardly counterparts. The taii'maku spellcasters envision the cosmos as bound by a set of logical principles that can be deciphered through mathematical expressions, deeming magic as an extension of the physical realm. This unique perspective enables them to interlace mathematics within their incantations, and as such, taii'maku wizards etch their spells as algebraic formulas in their grimoires, deeming conventional symbols to be cumbersome and inefficient. As bold adventurers embark on perilous journeys into the depths of time-forgotten ruins, they may chance upon ancient tomes inscribed by legendary taii'maku archmages or unearth enigmatic arcane mechanisms, both teeming with labyrinthine equations that call for the keen intellect of the most erudite taii'maku minds to decipher. As they navigate through the forsaken remnants of bygone Illus, they may unveil cryptic geometric patterns that cloak concealed chambers. Nestled within these shrouded sanctuaries, one may find elaborate taii'maku-crafted magic circles, poised to unleash formidable and mysterious forces. The taii'maku's unwavering belief in a world that is inherently logical and mathematically harmonious drives their relentless pursuit of transcending the limitations of the arcane. Through their groundbreaking amalgamation of mathematics and mysticism, they forge breathtaking spells, enchanted relics, and wondrous contraptions imbued with unparalleled potency. It is their fervent aspiration to harness these mystical creations to reshape the world for the better.

trait.name: Taii'maku Names
trait.text:
Taii'makian words usually consist of short syllables with hard consonants that are pronounced with one's jaws closed, creating a distinct sound that other species hardly ever re produce correctly. The words often sound harsh or rough. Their last names sometimes represent the city they hail from, with the addition of an adjective representing their personal purpose. To facilitate communication, the taii'maku may present themselves to other species only by their first name, keeping their full name for themselves.
Male Names: A'Kole, B'Abku, B'Ogaji, B'Un, C'Hakado, D'Alolo, D'Umikole, E'Boko, E'Dowu, E'Ntun, G'Honk, G'Ombo, J'Aborii, J'Oawari, K'Antobu, K'Obbimbe, K'Onego, K'Oyode, K'Uwako, L'Amumbo, M'Antuna, M'Bollo, N'Ingolo, O'Bimbolo, O'Kashar, O'Ketokunbo, O'Lujime, T'Hanlu, U'Chenno, Z'Hantan, Z'Ouwanga.
Female Names: A'Beba, A'Deuga, A'Isha, A'Laba, A'Yodela, B'Alan, B'Ennah, B'Onbya, B'Usari, C'Honwalla, D'Ainoka, D'Aljih, E'Nla, E'Thuhole, F'Alizah, G'Ainda, J'Ahali, K'Akilih, K'Anyeta, K'Azanatti, K'Oomanni, L'Atesha, L'Ifanni, M'Olaika, N'Aan, U'Gocha, V'Ulah, W'Anjika, Y'Eeja, Z'Alan.

trait.name: Age
trait.text: The taii'makus experience a swift maturation, concluding childhood at 8 years and achieving adulthood at the age of 16. Rarely do they live past the age of 80.

trait.name: Alignment
trait.text: Most taii'maku are lawful, holding strong beliefs in the systems and laws of their Ilus. They tend to neutrality over good and evil, keeping their personal beliefs to themselves for the greater good of society.

trait.name: Size
trait.text: Taii'maku are taller than humans, standing well over 6 to 7 feet tall and averaging 210 to 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

trait.name: Historical Nomadism
trait.text: You gain proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: History or Survival.

trait.name: Strong Hands
trait.text: Endowed with six fingers, taii'makus possess enhanced hand strength. You have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to climbing and saving throws against disarming effects.

trait.name: Mathematical Mind
trait.text: The unique and logical thought pro cess of the taii'maku grant them an edge with numbers and math. You have advantage on all ability checks directly in volving mathematical or accounting tasks.

trait.name: Mind Inclination
trait.text: Rather than subspecies, taii'maku display dispositions inclined either towards Philosophy, with a comprehensive approach, or Engineering, focusing on specific areas of study.

trait.name: Inclination to Engineering
trait.text: Taii'maku who choose to follow the math and engineering way are extremely focused, becoming the best at what they propose to be. In search of constant improvement in what they have chosen, they are even rough with what does not involve their studies.

trait.name: Innate Engineers
trait.text: You are proficient with tinker's tools. Additionally, when analyzing a mechanism such as an automaton or a mechanical trap, you can attempt an Intelligence (Investigation) check to determine its purpose and function. If successful, you or creatures to whom you have explained the mechanism have advantage in ability checks made to use or disable it.

trait.name: Ingenious Inventors
trait.text:
Using tinker's tools, you can construct magical mechanisms. Spend 1 hour and 20 gp on materials to create a mechanism, limited to three at any given time. If you create a fourth, you must sever the magical connection with an existing one. When creating a mechanism, choose from the following options:
Extended vision monocle. This device lets you see better. While wearing it, your vision range doubles, and you have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight. (Weight: 1)
Clock-compass. This item always shows you the exact time and which way is north. (Weight: 0)
Sound amplifier. This device helps you hear better. You have advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing. Alternatively, you can use it to amplify your voice so it can be heard twice as far. (Weight: 1)
Foldable glider. This item allows you to slow your fall and move forward. For every 5 feet you fall, you can move forward up to 5 feet reducing this distance from the fall, as long as you have enough space. If you can't move forward you take the remaining damage as normal. (Weight: 4)
Mechanical thrower. This item lets you throw a weapon or improvised weapon 10 feet farther than normal. (Weight: 1)
Automatic reloader. This item lets you ignore the loading property of a ranged weapon you are wielding twice, recovering its uses on a short rest. (Weight: 2)
Jumper. This gadget allows you to make extraordinary leaps. While wearing it, your jump range doubles, and you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to jumping. (Weight: 1)
Climber. This item allows you to climb easily. While wearing it, climbing does not cost you extra movement, and you have advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks related to climbing. (Weight: 1)
Carrying frame. This set of springs and gears helps you carry more weight. While wearing it, you are considered to have +3 to your Strength ability score for the purposes of calculating load and lifting weight, as well as for the Strength requirements of armor. (Weight: 3)
Potion injector. This contraption allows you to load a potion into a mounted reservoir at the end of a long rest. As a bonus action, you can inject the loaded potion directly into your bloodstream and receive its effects. (Weight: 2)

trait.name: Languages
trait.text:
You can speak, read, and write Common and Taii'makian.
The Taii'makian language is known for its hard syllables and closed-jaw pronunciation, traits that the taii'maku often apply to other tongues they know. Taii'makian runes, made up of geometric shapes, represent words and concepts; by combining up to four runes, a greater concept is created, resembling a sentence in Common. Foreigners often view these lines and markings as complicated mechanical sketches.
